The packages were designed to deliver a new malware loader called XORIndex, which can collect host and network data, profile victims, and download additional payloads.

item.title: Police disrupt “Diskstation” ransomware gang attacking NAS devices
item.description: This article discusses a law enforcement operation codenamed 'Operation Elicius' that dismantled a Romanian ransomware gang known as 'Diskstation', which targeted Synology Network-Attached Storage (NAS) devices. The gang encrypted the systems of several companies, paralyzing their businesses, and demanded ransom payments ranging from $10,000 to hundreds of thousands of dollars.

item.title: Hyper-Volumetric DDoS Attacks Reach Record 7.3 Tbps, Targeting Key Global Sectors
item.description: This article discusses a significant increase in distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attacks mitigated by Cloudflare in the second quarter of 2025. The article highlights the rise of hyper-volumetric DDoS attacks, which peaked at 7.3 terabits per second and 4.8 billion packets per second within a span of 45 seconds. It also discusses the increasing use of targeted probes by attackers to find weak spots and slip past defenses.

item.title: Ransomware Attack on Albemarle County Exposes Residents’ Personal Information
item.description: Albemarle County, Virginia, fell victim to a sophisticated ransomware attack despite having robust defenses in place, including endpoint detection and response systems, multi-factor authentication, and regular vulnerability patching. The attack exploited on-premises servers, potentially exposing sensitive personally identifiable information (PII) of local government and public school employees, as well as county residents.

item.title: Newly Emerged GLOBAL GROUP RaaS Expands Operations with AI-Driven Negotiation Tools
item.description: This article discusses a new ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) operation called GLOBAL GROUP that has targeted various sectors in Australia, Brazil, Europe, and the United States. The RaaS platform is designed to facilitate initial access brokers to deploy the ransomware by weaponizing access to vulnerable edge appliances from Cisco, Fortinet, and Palo Alto Networks.

item.title: Microsoft Explains How Security Copilot in Intune and Entra Supports Security and IT Teams
item.description: None (The article is not about a vulnerability or cybersecurity-relevant content, but rather discusses Microsoft's Security Copilot tool and its features for improving security and IT operations.)

item.title: Federal IT Contractor to Pay $14.75M for False Cybersecurity Services Claims
item.description: The article discusses a settlement between Hill ASC Inc. and the U.S. Department of Justice regarding allegations of violating the False Claims Act through improper billing practices under a General Services Administration (GSA) Multiple Award Schedule (MAS) contract. The alleged violations include fraudulent claims for IT personnel, unauthorized billing for cybersecurity services, and unapproved fees on government invoices.

item.title: DShield Honeypot Scanning Hits Record High with Over 1 Million Logs in a Single Day
item.description: The article reports an unusual surge in cyber reconnaissance activity detected by DShield honeypots, with web logs exceeding 1 GB daily and peaking at nearly 58 GB. The increase is attributed to automated scanning from overlapping subnets targeting specific URL paths, potentially probing for vulnerabilities or gathering intelligence for future exploits.

item.title: Iranian Threat Actors Target U.S. Critical Infrastructure, Including Water Systems
item.description: Intelligence Group 13, an elite unit within the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC), has been conducting asymmetric cyber operations in response to U.S. attacks on Iranian nuclear sites. The group uses advanced persistent threat (APT) techniques, including phishing-driven credential theft, open-source intelligence harvesting, and custom malware deployment for reconnaissance and sabotage. Its operations extend beyond technical compromise, incorporating psychological elements through propaganda fronts like CyberAveng3rs, which disseminates defacement screenshots, operational leaks, and taunting messages via Telegram and Instagram channels.

item.title: Kafbat UI Vulnerabilities Allow Arbitrary Code Execution via JMX Services
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Kafbat UI; CVE(s): CVE-2025-49127; Summary: The vulnerability allows unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary code by exploiting unsafe deserialization in Kafbat UI's metrics collection system. Attackers can specify malicious JMX servers that return crafted serialized objects, enabling Java deserialization gadget chains and complete system compromise.

item.title: Octalyn Stealer Harvests VPN Configs, Passwords, and Cookies in Organized Folder Structure
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Octalyn Forensic Toolkit; CVE(s): None; Summary: The Octalyn Forensic Toolkit is a credential stealer that poses as a research tool for red teaming and digital forensics. It can extract sensitive data including browser passwords, cookies, autofill information, Discord and Telegram tokens, VPN configurations, gaming account details, and cryptocurrency wallet artifacts. The toolkit's payload establishes persistence via Windows Startup folder entries and registry modifications, and can exfiltrate stolen data over TLS-secured connections to api.telegram.org.

item.title: Android malware Konfety uses malformed APKs to evade detection
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Konfety; CVE(s): None; Summary: The latest variant of the Konfety Android malware uses a malformed ZIP structure, obfuscation methods, and dynamic code loading to evade analysis and detection. It poses as a legitimate app, redirects users to malicious sites, pushes unwanted app installs, and steals information such as installed apps, network configuration, and system details.

item.title: GLOBAL GROUP RaaS Adds AI-Powered Negotiation Feature for Ransom Demands
item.description: The article discusses a Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) operation called GLOBAL GROUP that has deployed an AI-driven negotiation tool to pressure victims into paying ransoms. The operation uses Initial Access Brokers (IABs) to sell compromised VPN appliances and webshells, and its affiliates can deploy customized ransomware payloads that take advantage of chaos and speed to maximize damage before traditional endpoint defenses can react.

item.title: North Korean Hackers Exploit 67 Malicious npm Packages to Spread XORIndex Malware
item.description: Vulnerable Product: N/A; CVE(s): None; Summary: The Socket Threat Research Team discovered a software supply chain attack using the XORIndex malware loader, which has not been previously reported, attributed to North Korean state-backed actors. The attackers infiltrated the npm registry with 67 malicious packages, amassing over 17,000 downloads collectively, targeting developers, job seekers, and cryptocurrency holders by exfiltrating sensitive credentials and wallet data through a chain of malware stages.

item.title: BaitTrap Reveals Global Web of 17,000+ Fraud-Promoting Fake News Sites
item.description: A network of over 17,000 "Baiting News Sites" (BNS) has been discovered by cybersecurity firm CTM360, which are designed to disseminate investment fraud globally. These sites masquerade as authoritative news entities and use advanced social engineering tactics to target unsuspecting users with false information about lucrative investment opportunities.

item.title: New AsyncRAT Forks Discovered Featuring Screamer Tool and USB Malware Spreader
item.description: Vulnerable Product: AsyncRAT; CVE(s): None; Summary: The article describes two new variants of the AsyncRAT remote access trojan (RAT) that introduce a psychological warfare component and enhanced propagation mechanisms. The "Screamer" plugin manipulates Windows audio APIs to disorient victims, while the USB malware spreader component transforms AsyncRAT into a self-replicating worm capable of bridging air-gapped networks.

item.title: Hitachi Energy Asset Suite
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Hitachi Energy Equipment, including Asset Suite AnyWhere for Inventory (AWI) Android mobile app and Asset Suite 9 series; CVE(s): CVE-2019-9262, CVE-2019-9429, CVE-2019-9256, CVE-2019-9290, CVE-2025-1484, CVE-2025-2500; Summary: Multiple vulnerabilities in Hitachi Energy's Asset Suite product allow for unauthorized access, remote code execution, and privilege escalation.

item.title: LITEON IC48A and IC80A EV Chargers
item.description: Vulnerable Product: LITEONE IC48A and IC80A; CVE(s): CVE-2025-7357; Summary: Successful exploitation of the plaintext storage of a password vulnerability in Liteon EV chargers could allow an attacker to access sensitive information, with potential impacts on commercial facilities, energy, and transportation systems worldwide.

item.title: ABB RMC-100
item.description: Vulnerable Product: ABB RMC-100; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6071, CVE-2025-6072, CVE-2025-6073, CVE-2025-6074; Summary: The ABB RMC-100 has several vulnerabilities that allow an attacker to gain unauthenticated access to MQTT configuration data, cause a denial-of-service condition on the MQTT configuration web server (REST interface), or decrypt encrypted MQTT broker credentials.

item.title: CISA Releases Six Industrial Control Systems Advisories
item.description: CISA released six Industrial Control Systems (ICS) advisories on July 15, 2025, providing timely information about current security issues, vulnerabilities, and exploits surrounding ICS. The advisories cover various products from Hitachi Energy, ABB, LITEON, Schneider Electric, and others. Users and administrators are encouraged to review the advisories for technical details and mitigations.

item.title: Hacktivists Launch Attacks on ICS Systems to Exfiltrate Sensitive Information
item.description: The article highlights the increasing intensity of hacktivist attacks targeting Industrial Control Systems (ICS), with a focus on Operational Technology (OT) environments, Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) systems, and Human-Machine Interfaces (HMIs).

item.title: OpenAI's ChatGPT-powered browser is codenamed 'Aura'
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; FYSA: While cloud attacks may be growing more sophisticated, attackers still succeed with surprisingly simple techniques. This report reveals 8 key techniques used by cloud-fluent threat actors.

item.title: Ransomware Threat Grows as Attackers Move Into VMware and Linux
item.description: The article highlights the increasing trend of ransomware attacks targeting Linux environments, which were previously considered secure due to their reliability and inherent security. Threat actors are now engineering sophisticated Linux-specific ransomware variants, exploiting ubiquity in critical applications, APIs, DevOps pipelines, and virtualized infrastructures.

item.title: 14 Hackers Arrested in Massive Tax Fraud Scheme, Authorities Confirm
item.description: Authorities have arrested 14 individuals for a sophisticated tax fraud scheme that exploited stolen personal data to submit fraudulent claims worth over £1 million. The operation involved international cooperation between UK and Romanian law enforcement agencies, demonstrating the growing collaboration in combating cross-border cybercrime.

item.title: State-Backed HazyBeacon Malware Uses AWS Lambda to Steal Data from SE Asian Governments
item.description: The article discusses a previously undocumented Windows backdoor called HazyBeacon, which targets government agencies in Southeast Asia. The malware uses DLL side-loading techniques to deploy it on compromised hosts and establishes communication with an attacker-controlled URL to execute arbitrary commands and download additional payloads.

item.title: LaRecipe Tool with 2.3M Downloads Found Vulnerable to Full Server Takeover
item.description: Vulnerable Product: torch/larecipe; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53833; Summary: A critical Server-Side Template Injection (SSTI) vulnerability, identified as CVE-2025-53833, allows attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable systems, leading to Remote Code Execution (RCE). The vulnerability affects all versions prior to 2.8.1 and requires no authentication or user interaction.

item.title: Securing Agentic AI: How to Protect the Invisible Identity Access
item.description: This article is not about a vulnerability, but rather discusses the security implications of AI agents in cloud environments. It highlights the need for visibility into non-human identities (NHIs) and emphasizes the importance of applying least privilege and automation to ensure secure use of AI agents.

item.title: North Korean Hackers Exploit Zoom Invites in Attacks on Crypto Companies
item.description: The article describes an ongoing malware campaign orchestrated by North Korean threat actors targeting individuals and organizations within the Web3, cryptocurrency, and blockchain industries. The malware uses spear-phishing tactics, fake job opportunities, and social engineering to deploy a multi-stage attack chain that compromises macOS systems and exfiltrates sensitive data, including cryptocurrency wallet credentials and personal information.

item.title: AsyncRAT's Open-Source Code Sparks Surge in Dangerous Malware Variants Across the Globe
item.description: Vulnerable Product: AsyncRAT; CVE(s): None; Summary: AsyncRAT is a widely used remote access trojan that has evolved over the years, with its open-source nature allowing it to be modified and distributed by threat actors. It can capture screenshots, log keystrokes, steal credentials, and allow attackers to commandeer infected systems stealthily. The malware has spawned various variants, including DCRat, Venom RAT, and others, which have added new features and evasion techniques.

item.title: ZDI-25-592: Autodesk Revit RVT File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Write Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Autodesk Revit; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5037; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Autodesk Revit by parsing out-of-bounds write RVT files, requiring user interaction. The specific flaw exists within the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, resulting in a write past the end of an allocated object.

item.title: ZDI-25-593: Autodesk Revit RVT File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Autodesk Revit; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5037; Summary: The vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Autodesk Revit by parsing out-of-bounds read remote code execution. User interaction is required, and the issue results from lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a read past the end of an allocated object.

item.title: ZDI-25-594: Autodesk Revit RFA File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Autodesk Revit; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5037; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Autodesk Revit by parsing out-of-bounds read RFA files. User interaction is required, as the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a read past the end of an allocated buffer.

item.title: ZDI-25-595: Autodesk Revit RFA File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Autodesk Revit; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5037; Summary: The vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Autodesk Revit by exploiting an out-of-bounds read in the parsing of RFA files. User interaction is required, and the issue results from a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data.

item.title: ZDI-25-596: Autodesk Revit RTE File Parsing Heap-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Autodesk Revit; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5040; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Autodesk Revit, requiring user interaction to exploit. The flaw exists in the parsing of RTE files due to lack of proper validation of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length heap-based buffer.

item.title: ZDI-25-597: Autodesk Revit RFA File Parsing Memory Corruption Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Autodesk Revit; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5037; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Autodesk Revit by exploiting memory corruption in the parsing of RFA files. User interaction is required, and an attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current process.

item.title: British Citizen Sentenced for Islamophobic WiFi Hack at UK Train Stations
item.description: The article reports on a 37-year-old individual, John Andreas Wik, who was sentenced to 24 months in prison, suspended for two years, for orchestrating an Islamophobic hack of free WiFi landing pages at multiple train stations across Britain. The hack caused distress and fear among commuters, highlighting the misuse of digital infrastructure to spread hateful content.

item.title: MITRE Launches AADAPT Framework to Counter Real-World Attacks on Digital Asset Systems
item.description: The MITRE Corporation has released its AADAPT framework, a comprehensive knowledge base for understanding and countering sophisticated attacks targeting digital asset management systems, cryptocurrency exchanges, and blockchain infrastructure. The framework organizes threat intelligence into a twelve-tactic matrix covering the attack lifecycle, including techniques such as Channel Wormholing, Quantum Efficient Factorization, Chain Reorganization attacks, and Partial Payments Attacks.

item.title: Apache Tomcat Coyote Flaw Allows Attackers to Launch DoS Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apache Tomcat; CVE(s): None; Summary: The Tomcat Coyote module contains a vulnerability that allows malicious actors to orchestrate denial-of-service (DoS) attacks by manipulating stream concurrency limits in HTTP/2 protocol handling. This uncontrolled resource consumption issue can exhaust server threads, memory, or CPU resources, rendering the server unresponsive to legitimate requests.

item.title: NCC Advises Immediate Windows 11 Upgrade to Strengthen Cyberattack Defenses
item.description: The National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) has released recommended configuration packs for Microsoft Windows operating systems to improve security settings, warning that the end-of-life (EOL) of Windows 10 is imminent on October 14, 2025. The article highlights the risks of unpatched vulnerabilities and emphasizes the importance of transitioning to Windows 11, which offers enhanced security features such as Trusted Platform Module (TPM) 2.0, Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI), and Secure Boot capabilities.

item.title: Cybercriminals Clone CNN, BBC, and CNBC Sites to Lure Victims into Investment Fraud
item.description: A sprawling cybercrime syndicate has been uncovered, orchestrating a large-scale phishing and investment fraud campaign by cloning legitimate news outlets. The operation uses domain spoofing, typosquatting, and social engineering tactics to target users in the United States and other countries, with over 17,000 baiting websites created across 50 countries.

item.title: Government Organizations Targeted via AWS Lambda URL Endpoint Exploits
item.description: The CL-STA-1020 threat cluster targets government agencies in Southeast Asia with a previously undocumented Windows backdoor, HazyBeacon, which exploits AWS Lambda URLs to establish a stealthy command-and-control (C2) infrastructure.

item.title: PoC Released for High-Severity Git CLI Vulnerability Allowing Arbitrary File Writes
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Git; CVE(s): CVE-2025-48384; Summary: A critical vulnerability in Git's command-line interface allows arbitrary file writes and remote code execution on Linux and macOS systems. The vulnerability stems from a mismatch in Git's configuration parser behavior when processing control characters, enabling attackers to write malicious Git Hook scripts and achieve remote code execution.

item.title: CBI Uncovers Noida Tech Support Scam Targeting Victims in UK and Australia
item.description: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has taken down a sophisticated global cybercrime network that targeted people in Australia and the United Kingdom with tech support frauds. The syndicate used social engineering tactics, VoIP systems, proxy servers, and anonymized networks to evade detection. The CBI's operation, called Chakra-V, highlights the evolving landscape of cyber-enabled fraud and emphasizes the importance of international cooperation in combating cyber threats.

item.title: ImageMagick Vulnerability Enables RCE via Malicious File Name Patterns
item.description: Vulnerable Product: ImageMagick; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53101; Summary: A critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in ImageMagick's image processing library allows attackers to bypass stack buffer underwrite through carefully crafted filename templates. The flaw affects versions before 7.1.1-47 and 6.9.13-25, and has been addressed in versions 7.1.2-0 and 6.9.13-26.

item.title: North Korean Hackers Flood npm Registry with XORIndex Malware in Ongoing Attack Campaign
item.description: The North Korean threat actors linked to the Contagious Interview campaign have been publishing malicious packages on the npm registry, using software supply chain attacks to target developers. The packages, which include a previously undocumented malware loader codenamed XORIndex, have attracted over 17,000 downloads and incorporate known JavaScript loaders and stealers called BeaverTail, which is used to extract data from web browsers and cryptocurrency wallets, as well as deploy a Python backdoor referred to as InvisibleFerret.

item.title: Red Bull-Themed Phishing Attacks Target Job Seekers’ Credentials
item.description: This article discusses a phishing campaign targeting job seekers with spoofed Red Bull recruitment emails. The attackers leverage legitimate email services, transient VPS infrastructure, and brand impersonation to deliver malicious payloads that slip past SPF, DKIM, and DMARC checks.

item.title: DOGE Denizen Marko Elez Leaked API Key for xAI
item.description: A DOGE employee, Marko Elez, inadvertently published a private API key for xAI's large language models on GitHub, allowing access to at least 52 LLMs. The exposed key has not been revoked and is still functional, raising concerns about operational security and the handling of sensitive government information.

item.title: UK launches vulnerability research program for external experts
item.description: The UK's National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) has launched a new Vulnerability Research Initiative (VRI) to strengthen relations with external cybersecurity experts, aiming to improve the discovery and sharing of critical insights with the community. This initiative will involve partnering with skilled external vulnerability researchers to identify flaws in specific products, assess mitigations, and disclose findings through the 'Equities Process' procedure.

item.title: Interlock ransomware adopts FileFix method to deliver malware
item.description: The Interlock ransomware gang has adopted a new technique called "FileFix" to drop a remote access trojan (RAT) on targeted systems. FileFix is a social engineering attack that weaponizes trusted Windows UI elements to trick users into executing malicious PowerShell or JavaScript code without displaying any security warnings.

item.title: Nvidia chips become the first GPUs to fall to Rowhammer bit-flip attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: NVIDIA GPUs (A6000 and other GDDR6-based GPUs in Nvidia’s Ampere generation); CVE(s): None; Summary: The article discusses a vulnerability known as GPUhammer, which exploits Rowhammer bit flips to flip bits inside discrete GPUs and target GDDR6 GPU memory modules. The vulnerability is mitigated by ECC, but using ECC can also cause miscorrections and silent data corruption if three or more bit flips occur in a code word.

item.title: The Unusual Suspect: Git Repos
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: Multiple; CVE(s): None; Summary: Exposed Git repositories are a critical risk for most enterprises, allowing attackers to silently create shadow access into core systems. This is not just about poor hygiene, but a systemic and growing supply chain risk. Attackers can weaponize exposed code repositories by harvesting secrets, pivoting to compromised infrastructure, and exploiting internal systems.
FYSA: The threat landscape surrounding Git repositories is expanding rapidly due to the growing complexity of DevOps practices, widespread reliance on public version control platforms like GitHub, and human error. Attackers can use exposed credentials and secrets to gain initial access into cloud environments, databases, SaaS platforms, and more.

item.title: New PHP-Based Interlock RAT Variant Uses FileFix Delivery Mechanism to Target Multiple Industries
item.description: The article discusses a new PHP variant of the Interlock remote access trojan (RAT) used by the Interlock ransomware group. The campaign involves compromised websites injecting JavaScript code that redirects users to fake CAPTCHA verification pages, leading to the deployment of NodeSnake or PHP variants of the RAT.

item.title: Gigabyte motherboards vulnerable to UEFI malware bypassing Secure Boot
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Gigabyte motherboard models; CVE(s): CVE-2025-7029, CVE-2025-7028, CVE-2025-7027, CVE-2025-7026; Summary: Dozens of Gigabyte motherboard models run on UEFI firmware vulnerable to security issues that allow planting bootkit malware that is invisible to the operating system and can survive reinstalls. The vulnerabilities could allow attackers with local or remote admin permissions to execute arbitrary code in System Management Mode (SMM), an environment isolated from the operating system and with more privileges on the machine.

item.title: Dark Web Profile: APT36
item.description: APT36 is a Pakistan-linked state-sponsored cyber-espionage group active since at least 2013. The group targets Indian government bodies, defense contractors, armed forces, diplomatic missions, and research institutions, using phishing, remote-access trojans, and deceptive infrastructure to conduct long-term intelligence-gathering operations. Despite lacking sophistication, APT36 is highly persistent and adaptive, leveraging new platforms and cloud services, and malvertising campaigns to remain effective across South Asia's geopolitical threat landscape.

item.title: Gigabyte UEFI Firmware Vulnerability Allows Code Execution in SMM Privileged Mode
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Gigabyte motherboard; CVE(s): CVE-2023-XXXX (none listed); Summary: The firmware of multiple Gigabyte motherboard models contains vulnerabilities that allow attackers to execute arbitrary code in System Management Mode (SMM), enabling persistent malware installation, bootkit persistence, and system control even after OS reinstallation.
